byline.contributor: Michael Cieply contributed reporting from Los Angeles, and Emily Steel from New York.
byline.original: By BENJAMIN MUELLER and BENJAMIN WEISER

abstract: Federal criminal complaint against Alonzo Knowles, hacker who stole wide range of data about celebrities and media, identifies that his arrest was result of his traveling to New York City in person to consult with potential buyer.
lead_paragraph: Alonzo Knowles is accused of trying to sell television scripts and nude images of celebrities to an undercover federal agent.

headline.main: Man Charged With Hacking Stumbled by Taking Scheme Offline, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Man Charged With Hacking Stumbled by Taking Scheme Offline, Experts Say

snippet: Alonzo Knowles is accused of trying to sell television scripts and nude images of celebrities to an undercover federal agent.
